Thymoregulators'' are ''psychotropic'' drugs whose main clinical action is to '''reduce the frequency''', '''duration''' and '''intensity''' of '''thymic episodes''' (manic and depressive).

They represent a fairly restricted pharmacological class which includes :

* lithium salts,
* anticonvulsant thymoregulators: valpromide, sodium divalproate, carbamazepine, lamotrigine, etc.

question.title: What is the main clinical action of thymoregulators?

option_a.title: Reduce the frequency of thymic episodes

option_b.title: Increase the duration of thymic episodes

option_c.title: Increase the intensity of thymic episodes

option_d.title: Reduce the duration of thymic episodes

correct_option.title: Reduce the frequency of thymic episodes
correct_option.description: This consists only a letter of the correct option
